DataElement.preferredDefinition: The type of symptoms the person experienced that are consistent with COVID-19.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: An individual's perspective or subjective interpretation of an event or information._An acute infection of the respiratory tract that is caused by the severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2). Based on currently available information, SARS-CoV-2 is thought to mainly spread from person to person through respiratory droplets. Typically, there is a two- to 14-day incubation period and infected persons can present with no symptoms or mild to severe fever, dry cough, fatigue, and difficulty breathing. Dysgeusia, anosmia, and gastrointestinal and flu-like symptoms have also been reported. Older adults and persons of any age who have serious underlying medical conditions may be of higher risk for severe illness, including secondary infections, respiratory failure, and multi-organ dysfunction._Subjective evidence of disease perceived by the patient.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An individual's perspective or subjective interpretation of an event or information.:An acute infection of the respiratory tract that is caused by the severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2). Based on currently available information, SARS-CoV-2 is thought to mainly spread from person to person through respiratory droplets. Typically, there is a two- to 14-day incubation period and infected persons can present with no symptoms or mild to severe fever, dry cough, fatigue, and difficulty breathing. Dysgeusia, anosmia, and gastrointestinal and flu-like symptoms have also been reported. Older adults and persons of any age who have serious underlying medical conditions may be of higher risk for severe illness, including secondary infections, respiratory failure, and multi-organ dysfunction.

Concepts.definition: An individual's perspective or subjective interpretation of an event or information.

An acute infection of the respiratory tract that is caused by the severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2). Based on currently available information, SARS-CoV-2 is thought to mainly spread from person to person through respiratory droplets. Typically, there is a two- to 14-day incubation period and infected persons can present with no symptoms or mild to severe fever, dry cough, fatigue, and difficulty breathing. Dysgeusia, anosmia, and gastrointestinal and flu-like symptoms have also been reported. Older adults and persons of any age who have serious underlying medical conditions may be of higher risk for severe illness, including secondary infections, respiratory failure, and multi-organ dysfunction.

Property.preferredDefinition: An indication that a person has a condition or disease.  Some examples of symptoms are headache, fever, fatigue, nausea, vomiting, and pain.

Concepts.definition: Subjective evidence of disease perceived by the patient.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 2022-2-15 ak Released per DW review. 2021-12-7 ak Created for Project 5 Tier 1.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: An acute infection of the respiratory tract that is caused by the severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2). Based on currently available information, SARS-CoV-2 is thought to mainly spread from person to person through respiratory droplets. Typically, there is a two- to 14-day incubation period and infected persons can present with no symptoms or mild to severe fever, dry cough, fatigue, and difficulty breathing. Dysgeusia, anosmia, and gastrointestinal and flu-like symptoms have also been reported. Older adults and persons of any age who have serious underlying medical conditions may be of higher risk for severe illness, including secondary infections, respiratory failure, and multi-organ dysfunction._Subjective evidence of disease perceived by the patient._Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: To clear material from the throat or lungs by coughing it up and spitting it out.

Concepts.definition: To clear material from the throat or lungs by coughing it up and spitting it out.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A sudden, often repetitive, spasmodic contraction of the thoracic cavity, resulting in violent release of air from the lungs, and usually accompanied by a distinctive sound.

Concepts.definition: A sudden, often repetitive, spasmodic contraction of the thoracic cavity, resulting in violent release of air from the lungs, and usually accompanied by a distinctive sound.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Pain in various parts of the head, not confined to the area of distribution of any nerve.

Concepts.definition: Pain in various parts of the head, not confined to the area of distribution of any nerve.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A sensation of lightheadedness, unsteadiness, turning, spinning or rocking.

Concepts.definition: A sensation of lightheadedness, unsteadiness, turning, spinning or rocking.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Severe chills accompanied by vigorous shaking.

Concepts.definition: Severe chills accompanied by vigorous shaking.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Chills; a sensation of cold that often marks the start of an infection and the development of a fever.

Concepts.definition: Shivering or moderate tremors of the body often accompanied by a cold sensation.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A symptom report of fever without an objective temperature measurement.

Concepts.definition: A symptom report of fever without an objective temperature measurement.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Body temperature of 106 degrees Fahrenheit (41.1 degrees Celsius) or higher.

Concepts.definition: Body temperature of 106 degrees Fahrenheit (41.1 degrees Celsius) or higher.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Without clinical signs or indications that raise the possibility of a particular disorder or dysfunction.

Concepts.definition: Without clinical signs or indications that raise the possibility of a particular disorder or dysfunction.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A directive to specify when the listed responses are not sufficient.

Concepts.definition: A directive to specify when the listed responses are not sufficient.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The flow of blood from a ruptured blood vessel.

Concepts.definition: The flow of blood from a ruptured blood vessel.

PermissibleValues.value: Toe rashes (red/purple sores or blisters on the feet, including the toes)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A self-limited dermatologic manifestation seen on the toes of some patients with COVID-19 that resembles chilblains (perniosis). The lesions may be pink, red, blue or purple and have a similar appearance to frostbite. It appears to resolve once the infection has been cleared.

Concepts.definition: A self-limited dermatologic manifestation seen on the toes of some patients with COVID-19 that resembles chilblains (perniosis). The lesions may be pink, red, blue or purple and have a similar appearance to frostbite. It appears to resolve once the infection has been cleared.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Any change in the skin which affects its appearance or texture. A rash may be localized to one part of the body, or affect all the skin. Rashes may cause the skin to change color, itch, become warm, bumpy, dry, cracked or blistered, swell and may be painful.

Concepts.definition: Any change in the skin which affects its appearance or texture. A rash may be localized to one part of the body, or affect all the skin. Rashes may cause the skin to change color, itch, become warm, bumpy, dry, cracked or blistered, swell and may be painful.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Hair loss usually from the scalp. It may result in bald spots or spread to the entire scalp or the entire epidermis. It may be androgenetic or caused by chemotherapeutic agents, compulsive hair pulling, autoimmune disorders or congenital conditions.

Concepts.definition: Hair loss usually from the scalp. It may result in bald spots or spread to the entire scalp or the entire epidermis. It may be androgenetic or caused by chemotherapeutic agents, compulsive hair pulling, autoimmune disorders or congenital conditions.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Updated definition to current NCIt. mc 4/16/20

PermissibleValues.value: Paresthesia (numbness or tingling somewhere in the body)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Abnormal cutaneous sensations of tingling, numbness, pressure, cold, and warmth that an individual experiences without the presence of a stimulus. It results from functional disturbances of sensory neurons. Causes include peripheral vascular disease, peripheral neuropathy, and nerve damage.

Concepts.definition: Abnormal cutaneous sensations of tingling, numbness, pressure, cold, and warmth that an individual experiences without the presence of a stimulus. It results from functional disturbances of sensory neurons. Causes include peripheral vascular disease, peripheral neuropathy, and nerve damage.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The pores are generally fine with a papery thin texture that feels dry to the touch. Usually flaky and dull looking.

Concepts.definition: The pores are generally fine with a papery thin texture that feels dry to the touch. Usually flaky and dull looking.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An enlarged lymph node. Causes include viral and bacterial infections and cancers that affect the lymph nodes.

Concepts.definition: An enlarged lymph node. Causes include viral and bacterial infections and cancers that affect the lymph nodes.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The distal portion of the upper extremity. It consists of the carpus, metacarpus, and digits.: An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.: The structure found below the ankle joint required for locomotion.: Enlargement; expansion in size; sign of inflammation

Concepts.definition: The distal portion of the upper extremity. It consists of the carpus, metacarpus, and digits.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
The structure found below the ankle joint.
Enlargement; expansion in size; sign of inflammation

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A question about whether an individual has or had painful joints.

Concepts.definition: A question about whether an individual has or had painful joints.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Painful sensation originating from a muscle or group of muscles.

Concepts.definition: Painful sensation originating from a muscle or group of muscles.

PermissibleValues.value: Feeling of heaviness in arms or legs

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The portion of the upper extremity between the shoulder and the elbow. For clinical purposes this term is also used to refer to the whole superior limb.: An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.: The portion of the lower extremity between the knee and the ankle. For clinical purposes this term is also used to refer to the whole inferior limb.: A question about whether an individual has or had heaviness.

Concepts.definition: The portion of the upper extremity between the shoulder and the elbow. For clinical purposes this term is also used to refer to the whole superior limb.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
The portion of the lower extremity between the knee and the ankle. For clinical purposes this term is also used to refer to the whole inferior limb.
A question about whether an individual has or had heaviness.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Overall tiredness and lack of energy.

Concepts.definition: Overall tiredness and lack of energy.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Anosmia caused by severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2).

Concepts.definition: Anosmia caused by severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2).

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A discharge of fluid from the nose.

Concepts.definition: A discharge of fluid from the nose.

PermissibleValues.value: Cognitive issues (Hypoxia - Impaired judgment, memory loss, impaired motor coordination)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A decrease in the amount of oxygen in the body. Symptoms range from mild (impaired judgment, memory loss, impaired motor coordination) to severe (seizures and coma).: A difficulty, disorder, or condition needing resolution.: Of or being or relating to or involving cognition.

Concepts.definition: A decrease in the amount of oxygen in the body. Symptoms range from mild (impaired judgment, memory loss, impaired motor coordination) to severe (seizures and coma).
A difficulty, disorder, or condition needing resolution.
Of or being or relating to or involving cognition.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A speech disorder resulting in impaired utterance of sounds by the vocal folds.

Concepts.definition: A speech disorder resulting in impaired utterance of sounds by the vocal folds.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Any kind of inflammatory process of the tonsils, pharynx, or/and larynx characterized by pain in swallowing.

Concepts.definition: Any kind of inflammatory process of the tonsils, pharynx, or/and larynx characterized by pain in swallowing.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Pain in the chest.

Concepts.definition: Pain in the chest.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A bluish or purplish discoloration of the skin and mucous membranes resulting from a reduced amount of oxygenated hemoglobin in the blood.

Concepts.definition: A bluish or purplish discoloration of the skin and mucous membranes resulting from a reduced concentration of oxygenated hemoglobin in the blood.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A symptom and a finding during physical examination, characterized by a high-pitched, whistling sound during breathing. It results from the narrowing or obstruction of the respiratory airways. The most common causes of wheezing are asthma, chronic obstructive pulmonary disease, tracheobronchitis, and pulmonary edema.

Concepts.definition: A symptom and a finding during physical examination, characterized by a high-pitched, whistling sound during breathing. It results from the narrowing or obstruction of the respiratory airways. The most common causes of wheezing are asthma, chronic obstructive pulmonary disease, tracheobronchitis, and pulmonary edema.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An uncomfortable sensation of difficulty breathing. It may present as an acute or chronic sign of an underlying respiratory or heart disorder.

Concepts.definition: An uncomfortable sensation of difficulty breathing. It may present as an acute or chronic sign of an underlying respiratory or heart disorder.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A group of disorders that affect a person's ability to learn or process specific types of information which is in contrast to his/her apparent level of intellect.

Concepts.definition: A group of disorders that affect a person's ability to learn or process specific types of information which is in contrast to his/her apparent level of intellect.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A term referring to disorders characterized by the disruption of normal speech. It includes stuttering, lisps, dysarthria and voice disorders.: An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.: A category of disorders characterized by an impairment in the development of an individual's language capabilities, which is in contrast to his/her non-verbal intellect.

Concepts.definition: A term referring to disorders characterized by the disruption of normal speech. It includes stuttering, lisps, dysarthria and voice disorders.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
A category of disorders characterized by an impairment in the development of an individual's language capabilities, which is in contrast to his/her non-verbal intellect.

PermissibleValues.value: Intellectual disability (formerly known as mental retardation)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A broad category of disorders characterized by an impairment to the intelligence an individual possesses. These impairments can result from trauma, birth, or disease and are not restricted to any particular age group.

Concepts.definition: A broad category of disorders characterized by an impairment to the intelligence an individual possesses. These impairments can result from trauma, birth, or disease and are not restricted to any particular age group.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Failure to meet, or late achievement of developmental milestones.

Concepts.definition: Failure to meet, or late achievement of developmental milestones.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A specific behavioral problem that occurs in persistent patterns and characteristic clusters and that causes clinically significant impairment.

Concepts.definition: A specific behavioral problem that occurs in persistent patterns and characteristic clusters and that causes clinically significant impairment.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Excitement of psychotic proportions manifested by mental and physical hyperactivity, disorganisation of behaviour and elevation of mood.: An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.: A disorder of the brain that causes unusual shifts in mood, energy, activity levels and the ability to carry out day-to-day tasks. Often these moods range and shift from periods of elation and energized behavior to those of hopelessness and depression.

Concepts.definition: Excitement of psychotic proportions manifested by mental and physical hyperactivity, disorganisation of behaviour and elevation of mood.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.

A disorder of the brain that causes unusual shifts in mood, energy, activity levels and the ability to carry out day-to-day tasks. Often these moods range and shift from periods of elation and energized behavior to those of hopelessness and depression.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Thoughts of taking one's own life.

Concepts.definition: Thoughts of taking one's own life.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A class of traumatic stress disorders with symptoms that last more than one month. There are various forms of post-traumatic stress disorder, depending on the time of onset and the duration of these stress symptoms. In the acute form, the duration of the symptoms is between 1 to 3 months. In the chronic form, symptoms last more than 3 months. With delayed onset, symptoms develop more than 6 months after the traumatic event.

Concepts.definition: An anxiety disorder precipitated by an experience of intense fear or horror while exposed to a traumatic (especially life-threatening) event. The disorder is characterized by intrusive recurring thoughts or images of the traumatic event; avoidance of anything associated with the event; a state of hyperarousal and diminished emotional responsiveness. These symptoms are present for at least one month and the disorder is usually long-term.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A syndrome of unknown etiology. Chronic fatigue syndrome (CFS) is a clinical diagnosis characterized by an unexplained persistent or relapsing chronic fatigue that is of at least six months' duration, is not the result of ongoing exertion, is not substantially alleviated by rest, and results in substantial reduction of previous levels of occupational, educational, social, or personal activities. Common concurrent symptoms of at least six months duration include impairment of memory or concentration, diffuse pain, sore throat, tender lymph nodes, headaches of a new type, pattern, or severity, and nonrestorative sleep. The etiology of CFS may be viral or immunologic. Neurasthenia and fibromyalgia may represent related disorders. Also known as myalgic encephalomyelitis.

Concepts.definition: A syndrome of unknown etiology. Chronic fatigue syndrome (CFS) is a clinical diagnosis characterized by an unexplained persistent or relapsing chronic fatigue that is of at least six months' duration, is not the result of ongoing exertion, is not substantially alleviated by rest, and results in substantial reduction of previous levels of occupational, educational, social, or personal activities. Common concurrent symptoms of at least six months duration include impairment of memory or concentration, diffuse pain, sore throat, tender lymph nodes, headaches of a new type, pattern, or severity, and nonrestorative sleep. The etiology of CFS may be viral or immunologic. Neurasthenia and fibromyalgia may represent related disorders. Also known as myalgic encephalomyelitis.

PermissibleValues.value: Attention Deficit Disorder or Attention Deficit Hyperactivity Disorder (ADD/ADHD)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A disorder characterized by a marked pattern of inattention and/or hyperactivity-impulsivity that is inconsistent with developmental level and clearly interferes with functioning in at least two settings (e.g. at home and at school). At least some of the symptoms must be present before the age of 7 years.

Concepts.definition: A disorder characterized by a marked pattern of inattention and/or hyperactivity-impulsivity that is inconsistent with developmental level and clearly interferes with functioning in at least two settings (e.g. at home and at school). When present, the symptoms of hyperactivity are most often present before the age of 7 years. There are three recognized presentations or subtypes from most to least common: combined type, inattentive/distractible type, hyperactive/impulsive type.

PermissibleValues.value: Autism or Autism Spectrum Disorder (ASD), Asperger's| Disorder, Pervasive Developmental Disorder (PDD)
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Autism Autism Spectrum Disorder Asperger Syndrome Or Pervasive Developmental Disorder

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Autism Autism Spectrum Disorder Asperger Syndrome Or Pervasive Developmental Disorder
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A disorder characterized by marked impairments in social interaction and communication accompanied by a pattern of repetitive, stereotyped behaviors and activities. Developmental delays in social interaction and language surface prior to age 3 years.: A spectrum of developmental disorders that includes autism, Asperger syndrome, and Rett syndrome. Signs and symptoms include poor communication skills, defective social interactions, and repetitive behaviors.: A disorder most often diagnosed in the pediatric years in which the individual displays marked impairment in social interaction and a repetitive, stereotyped pattern of behavior. The individual, however, displays no delay in language or cognitive development, which differentiates Asperger Syndrome from autism.: An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.: A category of developmental disorders characterized by impaired communication and socialization skills. The impairments are incongruent with the individual's developmental level or mental age. These disorders can be associated with general medical or genetic conditions.

Concepts.definition: A disorder characterized by marked impairments in social interaction and communication accompanied by a pattern of repetitive, stereotyped behaviors and activities. Developmental delays in social interaction and language surface prior to age 3 years.

A spectrum of developmental disorders that includes autism, Asperger syndrome, and Rett syndrome. Signs and symptoms include poor communication skills, defective social interactions, and repetitive behaviors.

A disorder most often diagnosed in the pediatric years in which the individual displays marked impairment in social interaction and a repetitive, stereotyped pattern of behavior. The individual, however, displays no delay in language or cognitive development, which differentiates Asperger Syndrome from autism.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.

A category of developmental disorders characterized by impaired communication and socialization skills. The impairments are incongruent with the individual's developmental level or mental age. These disorders can be associated with general medical or genetic conditions.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Apprehension of danger and dread accompanied by restlessness, tension, tachycardia, and dyspnea unattached to a clearly identifiable stimulus.

Concepts.definition: Apprehension of danger and dread accompanied by restlessness, tension, tachycardia, and dyspnea unattached to a clearly identifiable stimulus.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A melancholy feeling of sadness and despair.

Concepts.definition: A melancholy feeling of sadness and despair.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A neurologic disorder caused by defective metabolism of the neurotransmitters in the brain. It is characterized by repeated involuntary movements (motor tics) and uncontrollable vocal sounds (vocal tics). The symptoms are usually manifested before the age of eighteen.

Concepts.definition: A neurologic disorder caused by defective metabolism of the neurotransmitters in the brain. It is characterized by repeated involuntary movements (motor tics) and uncontrollable vocal sounds (vocal tics). The symptoms are usually manifested before the age of eighteen.

PermissibleValues.value: Orthostasis (dizziness/lightheadedness/blackouts on sitting up or standing)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A condition characterized by development of symptoms while standing. It is an autonomic nervous system disorder and the symptoms are relieved once the person sits back down. Symptoms include heart palpitations, sweating, anxiety, lightheadedness, hyperpnea, anxiety, and blurred vision.

Concepts.definition: A condition characterized by development of symptoms while standing. It is an autonomic nervous system disorder and the symptoms are relieved once the person sits back down. Symptoms include heart palpitations, sweating, anxiety, lightheadedness, hyperpnea, anxiety, and blurred vision.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A temporary loss of consciousness or a temporary state of altered consciousness that results in memory loss.

Concepts.definition: A temporary loss of consciousness or a temporary state of altered consciousness that results in memory loss.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Painful sensation in the neck area.

Concepts.definition: Painful sensation in the neck area.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A deficit in equilibrium, which may manifest as unsteady ambulation or inability to maintain an upright position.

Concepts.definition: A deficit in equilibrium, which may manifest as unsteady ambulation or inability to maintain an upright position.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A finding referring to walking difficulties.: An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.: A sudden movement downward, usually resulting in injury.

Concepts.definition: A finding referring to walking difficulties.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
A sudden movement downward, usually resulting in injury.

PermissibleValues.value: Changes in hands and feet (Peripheral extremity changes) other than swelling
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Other Than Swelling Peripheral Limb Change

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Other Than Swelling Peripheral Limb Change
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Distinct from those already mentioned, listed, or considered.: Enlargement; expansion in size; sign of inflammation: On or near an edge or constituting an outer boundary; the outer area.: A body region referring to an upper or lower extremity.: The act of alteration or modification; changed or altered in form or character.

Concepts.definition: Distinct from those already mentioned, listed, or considered.
Enlargement; expansion in size; sign of inflammation
On or near an edge or constituting an outer boundary; the outer area.
A body region referring to an upper or lower extremity.
The act of alteration or modification; changed or altered in form or character.

PermissibleValues.value: Cannot move and/or feel one side of body or face

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Paralysis of one side of the body.: An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.: Having to do with one side of the body.: A loss of the sensation of feeling in an area of the body.

Concepts.definition: Paralysis of one side of the body.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
Having to do with one side of the body.
A loss of the sensation of feeling in an area of the body.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Prolonged, extreme exhaustion after physical or mental effort or stress.

Concepts.definition: Prolonged, extreme exhaustion after physical or mental effort or stress.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A reduction in overall body mass.

Concepts.definition: A reduction in total body weight.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Palpitations; unpleasant sensation of irregular and/or forceful beating of the heart.

Concepts.definition: An unpleasant sensation of irregular and/or forceful beating of the heart.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A sleep disorder characterized by excessive sleepiness during the daytime.

Concepts.definition: A sleep disorder characterized by excessive sleepiness.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Pain caused by a stimulus that would not normally provoke pain.

Concepts.definition: Pain caused by a stimulus that would not normally provoke pain.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An abnormal responsiveness or morbid excitability of an organ, its part, or entire organism or its part to stimuli.

Concepts.definition: Excited response to stimuli.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A sleep disorder characterized by difficulty in falling asleep and/or remaining asleep.

Concepts.definition: A sleep disorder characterized by difficulty in falling asleep and/or remaining asleep.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A feeling of general discomfort or uneasiness, an out-of-sorts feeling.

Concepts.definition: A feeling of general discomfort or uneasiness, an out-of-sorts feeling.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Painful sensation in the abdominal region.

Concepts.definition: Painful sensation in the abdominal region.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Ageusia caused by severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2).

Concepts.definition: Ageusia caused by severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2).

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Loss of appetite.

Concepts.definition: Loss of appetite.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Expelling the contents of the stomach and the sensations associated with it. They are symptoms of an underlying disease or condition and not a specific illness.

Concepts.definition: Expelling the contents of the stomach and the sensations associated with it. They are symptoms of an underlying disease or condition and not a specific illness.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Watery bowel movements.

Concepts.definition: Watery bowel movements.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Earache; a pain localized in the middle or inner ear.

Concepts.definition: Painful sensation in the ear region.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Conjunctivitis; inflammation of the conjunctiva of the eye.

Concepts.definition: Inflammation of the conjunctiva of the eye.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: An acute infection of the respiratory tract that is caused by the severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2). Based on currently available information, SARS-CoV-2 is thought to mainly spread from person to person through respiratory droplets. Typically, there is a two- to 14-day incubation period and infected persons can present with no symptoms or mild to severe fever, dry cough, fatigue, and difficulty breathing. Dysgeusia, anosmia, and gastrointestinal and flu-like symptoms have also been reported. Older adults and persons of any age who have serious underlying medical conditions may be of higher risk for severe illness, including secondary infections, respiratory failure, and multi-organ dysfunction.:Subjective evidence of disease perceived by the patient.:Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

Concepts.definition: An acute infection of the respiratory tract that is caused by the severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2). Based on currently available information, SARS-CoV-2 is thought to mainly spread from person to person through respiratory droplets. Typically, there is a two- to 14-day incubation period and infected persons can present with no symptoms or mild to severe fever, dry cough, fatigue, and difficulty breathing. Dysgeusia, anosmia, and gastrointestinal and flu-like symptoms have also been reported. Older adults and persons of any age who have serious underlying medical conditions may be of higher risk for severe illness, including secondary infections, respiratory failure, and multi-organ dysfunction.
Subjective evidence of disease perceived by the patient.
Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.
